resorts.name: brighton
resorts.about: Brighton is a friendly, mountain-focused resort in Big Cottonwood Canyon near Salt Lake City. It's prized for reliable snowfall, varied terrain for beginners through experts, lively terrain parks, short lift lines, and a long season—ideal for powder seekers and park riders alike.

resorts.name: nordic-valley
resorts.about: Nordic Valley is a small, family-oriented resort near Ogden known for affordable lift tickets, excellent beginner terrain, and extensive night skiing. It's a great place to learn and build confidence without large crowds.

resorts.name: powder-mountain
resorts.about: Powder Mountain offers massive skiable acreage and a low-lift-density experience. Renowned for tree skiing, open bowls, and a laid-back vibe, it’s ideal for riders who prioritize fresh snow and uncrowded terrain.

resorts.name: sundance
resorts.about: Sundance Resort blends art, nature, and skiing on a scenic mountain founded by Robert Redford. It features varied terrain, intimate slope-side lodging, and a quieter, more boutique mountain experience with access to Nordic and backcountry routes.

resorts.name: alta
resorts.about: Alta is a legendary, skier-only mountain in Little Cottonwood Canyon known for extraordinary snowfall and steep, technical terrain. It's a powder-lover's paradise with a traditional, no-frills ski culture and excellent advanced lines.

resorts.name: snowbird
resorts.about: Snowbird sits adjacent to Alta and is famous for big snow, long verticals, and challenging terrain accessed by a high-capacity tram. It offers sustained steep runs, advanced terrain, and a season that often extends deep into spring.

resorts.name: solitude
resorts.about: Solitude Mountain Resort delivers a quieter, family-friendly experience with a balanced mix of groomers, bowls, and gladed tree skiing. Less crowded than neighboring resorts, it’s popular with families and riders who want varied terrain in a relaxed setting.

resorts.name: deer-valley
resorts.about: Deer Valley is an upscale, skier-only resort renowned for impeccably groomed runs, top-tier guest services, and limited lift capacity to preserve experience quality. It’s ideal for visitors who value comfort, dining, and consistent slope conditions.

resorts.name: brian-head
resorts.about: Brian Head is a high-elevation southern Utah resort offering family-friendly terrain, affordable lift tickets, and plenty of beginner and intermediate runs. Its location and elevation make it a convenient choice for varied conditions and night skiing.

resorts.name: park-city
resorts.about: Park City Mountain is one of North America’s largest resorts with extensive terrain, modern lift infrastructure, and strong town amenities. It suits all ability levels and hosts a lively après-ski scene, year-round events, and excellent access from Salt Lake City.
